EnumProperty.Name: CompileAs
EnumProperty.Description: Select compile language option for .c, .cpp, .asm files.

EnumValue.Name: CompileAsC
EnumValue.Description: Compile as C Code

EnumValue.Name: CompileAsCpp
EnumValue.Description: Compile as C++ Code

EnumValue.Name: CompileAsAsm
EnumValue.Description: Compile as Assembly Code

EnumValue.Name: CompileAsCHeader
EnumValue.Description: Compile as C Header Code

EnumValue.Name: CompileAsCppHeader
EnumValue.Description: Compile as C++ Header Code

StringListProperty.Name: ForcedIncludeFiles
StringListProperty.Description: Process file as if "#include "file"" appeared as the first line of the primary source file. (-include [path])

StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalIncludeDirectories
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more directories to add to the include path; separate with semi-colons if more than one. (-I[path])

StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalQuotationIncludeDirectories
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more directories to be searched for header files only for the case of #include "file" separate with semi-colons if more than one. (-iquote[path])

BoolProperty.Name: GenerateDebuggingInformation
BoolProperty.Description: Produce debugging information in the operating system's native format (stabs, COFF, XCOFF, or DWARF 2). GDB can work with this debugging information.

EnumProperty.Name: WarningLevel
EnumProperty.Description: Select how strict you want the compiler to be about code errors.

EnumValue.Name: TurnOffAllWarnings
EnumValue.Description: Disables all warnings.

EnumValue.Name: Level1
EnumValue.Description: Enables default warnings.

EnumValue.Name: Level2
EnumValue.Description: Enables all warnings, including those disabled by default.

EnumValue.Name: Level3
EnumValue.Description: Enables all warnings, and any extra warning flags that are not enabled by -Wall

EnumValue.Name: Level4
EnumValue.Description: Enables all warnings, and any extra warning flags that are not enabled by -Wall

EnumValue.Name: EnableAllWarnings
EnumValue.Description: Enables all warnings, and any extra warning flags that are not enabled by -Wall

BoolProperty.Name: TreatWarningAsError
BoolProperty.Description: Treats all compiler warnings as errors. For a new project, it may be best to use -Werror in all compilations; resolving all warnings will ensure the fewest possible hard-to-find code defects.

EnumProperty.Name: CompileAsManaged
EnumProperty.Description: Use the .NET runtime service. This switch is incompatible with some other switches; see the documentation on the /clr family of switches for details.

EnumValue.Name: false
EnumValue.Description: No Common Language RunTime Support

EnumProperty.Name: Optimization
EnumProperty.Description: Select option for code optimization; choose Custom to use specific optimization options. (/Od, /O1, /O2, /Ox)

EnumValue.Name: Disabled
EnumValue.Description: No optimization.

EnumValue.Name: MinSpace
EnumValue.Description: Compiler tries to reduce code size and execution time, without performing any optimizations that take a great deal of compilation time.

EnumValue.Name: MaxSpeed
EnumValue.Description: Compiler performs nearly all supported optimizations that do not involve a space-speed tradeoff.

EnumValue.Name: Full
EnumValue.Description: Optimize yet more. Full Optimization and aggressive inlining.

EnumValue.Name: Og
EnumValue.Description: Enables optimizations that do not interfere with debugging. It should be the optimization level of choice for the standard edit-compile-debug cycle.

EnumValue.Name: Os
EnumValue.Description: Optimize for size. -Os enables all -O2 optimizations that do not typically increase code size.

EnumValue.Name: Ofast
EnumValue.Description: Disregard strict standards compliance. -Ofast enables all -O3 optimizations. It also enables optimizations that are not valid for all standard-compliant programs.

BoolProperty.Name: OmitFramePointers
BoolProperty.Description: Suppresses creation of frame pointers on the call stack.

BoolProperty.Name: UserHeaderDependenciesOnly
BoolProperty.Description: Only export user (non-system) headers for dependency checking.

BoolProperty.Name: PositionIndependentCode
BoolProperty.Description: Generate position-independent code (PIC) suitable for use in a shared library.

IntProperty.Name: InlineLimitSize
IntProperty.Description: By default, GCC limits the size of functions that can be inlined. This flag allows coarse control of this limit. n is the size of functions that can be inlined in number of pseudo instructions.

BoolProperty.Name: FunctionSections
BoolProperty.Description: Place each function into its own section in the output file if the target supports arbitrary sections.

BoolProperty.Name: StrictAliasing
BoolProperty.Description: Allow the compiler to assume the strictest aliasing rules applicable to the language being compiled.

BoolProperty.Name: UnswitchLoops
BoolProperty.Description: Move branches with loop invariant conditions out of the loop, with duplicates of the loop on both branches (modified according to result of the condition).

EnumProperty.Name: ExceptionHandling
EnumProperty.Description: Generates extra code needed to propagate exceptions. If you do not specify this option, GCC enables it by default for languages like C++ that normally require exception handling, and disables it for languages like C that do not normally require it.

EnumValue.Name: Default
EnumValue.Description: Allow GCC/Clang determine whether to allow C++ Exceptions.

EnumValue.Name: Disabled
EnumValue.Description: Disable C++ Exceptions.

EnumValue.Name: Enabled
EnumValue.Description: Enable C++ Exceptions.

EnumProperty.Name: RuntimeTypeInfo
EnumProperty.Description: Control generation of information about every class with virtual functions for use by the C++ runtime type identification features ('dynamic_cast' and 'typeid').

EnumValue.Name: Default
EnumValue.Description: Allow GCC/Clang determine whether to allow C++ RTTI.

EnumValue.Name: Disabled
EnumValue.Description: Disable C++ RTTI.

EnumValue.Name: Enabled
EnumValue.Description: Enable C++ RTTI.

BoolProperty.Name: UnwindTables
BoolProperty.Description: Similar to -fexceptions, except that it just generates any needed static data, but does not affect the generated code in any other way.

EnumProperty.Name: StackProtection
EnumProperty.Description: Control 'Stack Smashing Protector' (SSP) settings for protecting applications from stack smashing attacks. This is the single largest class of attacks.

EnumValue.Name: Disabled
EnumValue.Description: No stack protection.

EnumValue.Name: StringProtection
EnumValue.Description: Enable stack protection for strings, and functions with arrays of length seven or less.

EnumValue.Name: FullProtection
EnumValue.Description: Enable stack protection for all functions with no size limit.

EnumProperty.Name: ArmFloatingPointAbi
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies which floating-point ABI to use.

EnumValue.Name: Soft
EnumValue.Description: Specifying 'soft' causes GCC to generate output containing library calls for floating-point operations. (-mfloat-abi=soft)

EnumValue.Name: SoftFp
EnumValue.Description: 'softfp' allows the generation of code using hardware floating-point instructions, but still uses the soft-float calling conventions. (-mfloat-abi=softfp)

EnumValue.Name: Hard
EnumValue.Description: 'hard' allows generation of floating-point instructions and uses FPU-specific calling conventions. (-mfloat-abi=hard)

EnumProperty.Name: ArmFloatingPointHardware
EnumProperty.Description: This specifies what floating-point hardware (or hardware emulation) is available on the target.

StringListProperty.Name: PreprocessorDefinitions
StringListProperty.Description: Defines a preprocessing symbols for your source file.

StringListProperty.Name: UndefinePreprocessorDefinitions
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more preprocessor undefines. (-U[macro])

EnumProperty.Name: PrecompiledHeader
EnumProperty.Description: Create/Use Precompiled Header : Enables creation or use of a precompiled header during the build.

EnumValue.Name: Create
EnumValue.Description: Instructs the compiler to create a precompiled header file that represents the state of compilation at a certain point.

EnumValue.Name: Use
EnumValue.Description: Instructs the compiler to use an existing precompiled header file in the current compilation.

EnumValue.Name: NotUsing
EnumValue.Description: Not using precompiled headers.

StringProperty.Name: PrecompiledHeaderFile
StringProperty.Description: Specifies header file name to use when creating or using a precompiled header file.

StringProperty.Name: PrecompiledHeaderOutputFile
StringProperty.Description: Specifies the path and/or name of the generated precompiled header file.

StringProperty.Name: ObjectFileName
StringProperty.Description: Specifies a name to override the default object file name; can be file or directory name. (-o [name])

StringListProperty.Name: SystemIncludeDirectories
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more directories to add to the include path; separate with semi-colons if more than one. (-I[path])

StringListProperty.Name: SysRoot
StringListProperty.Description: Use specified folder as the logical root directory for headers and libraries. (--sys-root=[dir])

BoolProperty.Name: NoCanonicalPrefixes
BoolProperty.Description: Do not expand any symbolic links, resolve references to ‘/../’ or ‘/./’, or make the path absolute when generating a relative prefix.
